4 hours ago, Wheehaw Kerman said:

I’m kind of annoyed that they hotfixed the bug so fast I literally wasn’t able to test MkIs with and without heat shields to see if that made any difference.

Did anybody test that?

I always fly with a heatshield, so I can tell you for sure it makes no difference. People saw it with bare capsules and with heatshields, which makes perfect sense I think as you consider the bug. Regardless of what is above the decoupler (a heatshield or a bare command pod bottom), the drag for that surface is occluded by the decoupler. Since the game (pre-hot fix) was not reassessing the drag after decoupling, the drag for the newly exposed surface would be zero (occluded) and not what it should be. Makes no diff with or without a heatshield, so always cover your bottom, please.

Also... YAY HOTFIX! THANK YOU!

ARE YOU FREAKING NUTS!?
THIS?!

No. No! NO!!!!

No, you don't get to insert a freaking "launcher" into this game! If I double-click on Ksp2_x64.exe I expect the game to LAUNCH!
"Maybe they won't notice"? Is that what you said? "Maybe they won't care"? Was that it @Nate Simpson? I'm talking to you, Buster!

REMOVE YOUR FREAKING STUPID TWO-PUT LAUNCHER.

I'm not asking you. I'm telling you this.

Is it your plan to alienate the modding community? We don't play this game like other players do. On a typical day, I'm launching the game 50 or 100 times. I'm in and then back out again testing things... MAKING YOUR $#!@ GAME BETTER FOR YOU AT NO FREAKING COST TO YOU! So is your great plan here to alienate your most loyal base - the people who don't just play the game, they tirelessly work to make it better for others?

Here's the deal. If there's a two-put launcher on this game I'm not launching it. Period. I'm done.
